title: Teaching
text:
In Political Science:


Lecturer at McGill University (2023-2024)

Designed courses and taught them to undergraduate students.
-   POLI 339 Nationalism, Ethnicity and the Radical Right in Europe (Comparative/Developed)
-   POLI 431 Nations and States/Developed World



Teaching Assistant at McGill University (2018-2023)

Assisted faculty at the Department of Political Science by conducting conferences (seminars) and grading undergraduates.
-   POLI 212 Government and Politics/Developed World
-   POLI 357 Politics: Contemporary Europe
-   POLI 329 Russian and Soviet Politics
-   POLI 339 Comparative Immigration Politics (Comparative/Developed)
-   POLI 442 International Relations of Ethnic Conflict
-   POLI 423 Politics of Ethno-Nationalism


Outside Political Science (click to view):


Lecturer at Lomonosov Moscow State University (2012-2017)

Designed courses and taught them to undergraduate and graduate students.
-   Race in Early 20th-Century American Culture
-   History of American Literature
-   History of American and British Literature (Early 20th Cent.)
-   History of Western European Literature (Early 19th Cent.)
-   History of Western European Literature (Late 19th Cent.)
-   History of Western European Literature (Early 20th Cent.)
-   Western European Cultural History (Early 20th Cent.)



Lecturer at Knowledge Exchange Institute (2013-2017)

Designed courses and taught them to American undergraduate and graduate exchange students at Lomonosov MSU.
-   History of Russian Literature
-   Russian Cultural History



© Andrey Davydov 2024

title: Andrey Davydov
text:
I am a Ph.D. Candidate in Political Science at McGill University.
My dissertation looks at the impact of the Russian regime’s selective adoption of international radical right rhetoric on diverse ideological strands of the opposition. I use computational text analysis methods on transcripts generated from audio data such as propaganda programs, which I combine with a theoretical grounding in nationalism studies. Broadly, I am working on ethnic nationalism, the radical right, its tensions with the centre-right, and white identity politics. I am a comparativist specialising in Western and Eastern Europe, particularly Russia and Ukraine.
Before joining McGill and becoming a political scientist, I lectured on Western European and American cultural history and literature at the Department of Foreign Languages and Area Studies at Lomonosov Moscow State University. My previous research focused on American and British racial theories in the interwar period. I hold a degree in Western European Studies (UK and Germany).


© Andrey Davydov 2024
